% 
% File:   test3.qasm
% Date:   22-Mar-04
% Author: I. Chuang <ichuang@mit.edu>
%
% Sample qasm input file - swap circuit
%
%         qubit 	q0
%         qubit 	q1
% 
% 	cnot	q0,q1
% 	cnot	q1,q0
% 	cnot	q0,q1

%  Time 01:
%    Gate 00 cnot(q0,q1)
%  Time 02:
%    Gate 01 cnot(q1,q0)
%  Time 03:
%    Gate 02 cnot(q0,q1)

% Qubit circuit matrix:
%
% q0: gAxA, gBxA, gCxA, n  
% q1: gAxB, gBxB, gCxB, n  

\documentclass[preview]{standalone}
\input{xyqcirc.tex}

% definitions for the circuit elements

\def\gAxA{\b\w\A{gAxA}}
\def\gAxB{\o\w\A{gAxB}}
\def\gBxB{\b\w\A{gBxB}}
\def\gBxA{\o\w\A{gBxA}}
\def\gCxA{\b\w\A{gCxA}}
\def\gCxB{\o\w\A{gCxB}}

% definitions for bit labels and initial states

\def\bA{ \q{q_{0}}}
\def\bB{ \q{q_{1}}}

% The quantum circuit as an xymatrix

\xymatrix@R=5pt@C=10pt{
    \bA & \gAxA &\gBxA &\gCxA &\n  
\\  \bB & \gAxB &\gBxB &\gCxB &\n  
%
% Vertical lines and other post-xymatrix latex
%
\ar@{-}"gAxB";"gAxA"
\ar@{-}"gBxA";"gBxB"
\ar@{-}"gCxB";"gCxA"
}

\end{document}
